page.title: 10Kennet and Avon Canal
page.content: the{River Kennet}to the{River Avon. The original route was via Hungerford,Ramsbury, Marlborough Melksham and Bradford on Avon, but Rennie proposed another, more southerly route from Hungerford to Great Bedwyn,Devizes, Trowbridge and Bradford.This took until 1810 to complete.This was because of the very steep rise at Caen Hill outside Devizes.A flight of 17 locks each with a side pond was built to overcome this.It cost over one million pounds to complete but eventually the canal was finished. The canal passes through the South East corner of our Domesday section. This part of the canal is fed by the {Froxfield feeder,}a unique circular weir, which divides the water between
